page.title: 02Auchmaliddie,New Deer
page.content:
The name{Auchmaliddie}is derived from the{Gaelic}for "the field of the rocking stones". {Local legend}says that a farmer was walking along a road in the area, smoking his pipe when the wind blew the lid off the top of his pipe and he said{"Och! Ma Liddie!"(Auchmaliddie) Although this tale is very colourful the authenticity of the first explanation is supported by the presence of{numerous other Gaelic {place names in this locality}(for example the next village is called Auchnagatt,"the field of the cat")
Kate T.Smith,South Mains of Auchmaliddie.
